#Text=Protect Your Small Business
#Text=Most small businesses are begun as simple ideas , and grow into successful enterprises because of the motivation and entrepreneurial enthusiasm of their owners .
#Text=As your small business becomes more successful , it also becomes more vulnerable .
#Text=There are many potential disasters that can harm your business , and you need to be prepared to defend yourself as you grow .
#Text=Protect your small business from technological and financial threats as well as threats to its reputation by being prepared and vigilant about prevention strategies .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Protecting Against Financial Threats
#Text=Protect your small business from potential lawsuits .
#Text=Lawsuits can be expensive , even if you are confident that you will win .
#Text=You will still have to pay for legal representation and spend a lot of time defending your company .
#Text=Watch your actions and words .
#Text=Avoid doing business with people who have a reputation for unscrupulous behavior and do not engage in questionable business practices .
#Text=Be careful of conflicts of interest .
#Text=Avoid situations that could be perceived as suspicious as well .
#Text=Insure your small business .

#Text=Make sure you have enough liability insurance and consider additional coverage such as errors and omissions insurance or a directors and officers ( D&O ) policy if you operate under a board of directors .
#Text=Assess your ability to withstand a catastrophe .
#Text=An unexpected disaster such as a fire or a hurricane could destroy your business , leaving you without income or a plan to rebuild .
#Text=Talk to your insurance agent about what is appropriate for your small business .
#Text=Each business has different needs .
#Text=Develop a crisis plan .
#Text=If disaster strikes , you and your employees should know exactly what to do .
#Text=Include plans for any inventory , technology and how you will communicate with your customers .
#Text=Watch your cash and profits .
#Text=Keep checks and balances and other controls in place to avoid being robbed or losing your hard-earned profits .
#Text=Be careful who you hire .
#Text=Conduct background checks and screen all employees and consultants , especially those with access to company finances .
#Text=Audit your business finances at least every quarter .
#Text=Require timely payments from clients and customers .
#Text=Waiting for payments can cause cash flow problems .
#Text=Insist on payment for services and goods within a reasonable amount of time , such as 30 days .
#Text=Work with a good tax attorney or financial advisor .
#Text=Small businesses are eligible for many tax breaks .
#Text=Make sure you are taking advantage of all of them .
#Text=Protecting Against Technological Threats
#Text=Understand cyber crimes and your company 's vulnerability .
#Text=Hackers often target small businesses because they have less computer security than large corporations .
#Text=Keep all of your data and intellectual property protected .
#Text=Use antivirus software and install a firewall for your network .
#Text=Hire an IT expert to perform a risk assessment and recommend additional measures .
#Text=A data breach could be damaging for your small business , especially if a hacker can access your financial information , or that of your customers .
#Text=Keep your intellectual property in your own hands .
#Text=File for intellectual property ( IP ) protection through the U.S. Patent and Trademark office .
#Text=Protecting Against Threats to Your Reputation
#Text=Use social media responsibly .
#Text=While most small businesses can benefit from Facebook pages and Twitter profiles , remember that the digital dialogue can include people unhappy with your business .
#Text=Use online conversations to promote your products and services , and invite your customers and clients to discuss what they like about working with you .
#Text=Do not overreact to negative comments .
#Text=Deleting anything that sheds unfavorable light on your small business might damage your reputation even more .
#Text=You want to be transparent .
#Text=Have a trusted customer or supportive partner respond to any attacks against your business with a positive story or testimonial .
#Text=Develop a crisis communications plan .
#Text=If something happens that can damage your reputation , you need to be prepared .
#Text=Prepare a plan to respond to customers , the media and any other stakeholders .
#Text=Consider working with a public relations professional .
#Text=Keeping a PR team on retainer might be prohibitive for your small business .
#Text=However , talk to PR professionals about engaging their services on a per-project basis .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Stay up to date on the various threats that small businesses need to be aware of .
#Text=Read publications such as Entrepreneur and e-newsletters such as SmallbizTrends .
#Text=Talk to your professional network about what other business owners are doing , and enlist all your employees and partners to help protect your small business .
